remarks.para: EICAS and/or STANDBY indications for one engine may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Appropriate procedures, AOM limitations, and performance decrements are applied,
N1, N2 and N3 EICAS indications for associated engine are operative,
N1 STANDBY indications for associated engine are operative,
Fuel flow indications for associated engine are operative, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.
Place the Electronic Engine Controls (EECs) switches to the INOP position.

note.para: With EECs deactivated there will be no Command Sector indication and the autothrottle will disconnect.

numlitem.para: Verify that N1, N2, N3 and Fuel Flow systems on the affected engine are operating normally.
Reduced thrust operation using the assumed temperature method or improved climb performance is not permitted.
Use of Derate 1 and Derate 2 thrust is not permitted.
Apply the performance weight decrements in column 8 Limitations/Performance Penalties.
Adjust the takeoff speeds as follows: Add 2 knots to V1 and add 1 knot to VR.

Procedures are unchanged except N1 power settings are used in lieu of EPR. For takeoff, thrust levers are advanced to 60% N1 prior to brake release or as the aircraft is aligned with the runway. Set takeoff N1 by 80 knots.

Use the following charts to determine % N1 for Maximum Takeoff, Maximum Climb, Maximum Cruise, Maximum Go-Around, and Maximum Continuous. Determine other thrust settings by use of N1 from the engine with operable EPR indication.

entry.para: VALID FOR 2 PACKS ON, EEC OFF
VALID FOR 2 PACKS ON, ENG AND WING A/I OFF
VALID FOR 2 PACKS ON, ENG AND WING A/I OFF

table.title: RB211–535E4 % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING GO-AROUND

entry.para: VALID FOR 2 PACKS ON, EEC OFF

table.title: RB211–535E4 % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING INITIAL MAX CONT %N11 ENGINE INOP

entry.para: VALID FOR 1 A/C PACL ON EEC OFF
ONE PACK ON NORMAL FLOW WITH APU OFF
DO NOT APPLY PACKS OFF CORR

table.title: RB211–535E4 1 ENGINE INOP % N1 ALTERNATE THRUST SETTING MAX CONT % N1
RB211–535E4 1 ENGINE INOP % N1 % N1 CORRECTIONS
RB211–535E4 1 ENGINE INOP % N1 MAX CONT % N1

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1.
Use of pushbutton derate operation for Takeoff and/or Climb not permitted.
Reduced thrust using Assumed Temperature method not permitted.
Use of autothrottle not permitted.
Use of improved climb performance is not permitted.
Observe limitations:
Takeoff Runway Limit Wt. when limited by VMBE, RNWY, TIRE: 9,200 lbs.
Takeoff Runway Limit weight limited by OBST: 17,300 lbs.
Takeoff Climb Limit Wt. 17,300 lbs.
Climb Limit Wt. for Landing 16,200 lbs.
Method 1/Method 2 Terrain Clearance Climb Limit Wt. (AOM Ch. 5) 15,100 lbs.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "L (R) EPR INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
